CatDescriptText: Mr. R.D. Pietro, college student, Beechview and Mr. Edward Harrison, porter, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 15, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "In dispensing political patronage jobs to various groups, what should bet eh determining factor- the financial contribution of that group to the party, or the number of votes the group casts for the party?" Mr. R.D. Pietro's answer reads: "I think the jobs should be distributed in regards to the ability of the appointee to help the party in general...I think the votes are more important than the financial contributions."  Mr. Edward Harrison's with question: "In dispensing political patronage jobs to various groups, what should bet eh determining factor- the financial contribution of that group to the party, or the number of votes the group casts for the party?" answer reads: "The votes should be the main consideration."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of R.D. Pietro wearing eyeglasses, diagonally striped necktie, and zippered jacket with knit stripe, standing on sidewalk in front of street car, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Edward Harrison wearing tweed hat, moustache, and light colored scarf, standing on sidewalk in front of building with sign in store window that reads "Color..."
